Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto (6 ll.) and names of 9 witnesses (probably more originally) on verso. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Sale of building land with foundations of a house in the S. district of Djeme by three persons to Serapion son of Zeho(?). (prasis). Date lost. (probably Euergetes II). Origin. Gebelen or Thebes".
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1990a / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum IV: Ptolemaic Legal Texts from the Theban Area (p.75-8, pl.63-4)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (47522) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/47522)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, fragmentary Black ink Tabbed: kraft paper Tabbed: glassine paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: masking tape Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: incomplete/fragmentary
